alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kit Carson County through 615 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles north of Stratton, moving southeast at 35 mph. Little to no rainfall is expected with this storm. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burlington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 436 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 185 and 206, and near mile marker 211. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
